RepACL

RepACL is an API that implements in Repast a group of concepts related to the FIPA interaction protocols. RepACL was based on JADE's implementation of these protocols, therefore making the conversion of Repast projects to JADE applications more straightforward, using MASSim2Dev.

This page tried to document the structure and usage of the API and provide some code examples.

Classes

Examples

Basic Agent and Behavior

This example requires that the RepACL and the Repast Simphony libraries be added to the Java build path.

|MyAgent.java
import up.fe.liacc.repacl.Agent;
 
public class MyAgent extends Agent{
 
	public MyAgent() {
		super();
		addBehavior(new MyBehavior(this));
	}
}
|MyBehavior.java
import repast.simphony.engine.schedule.ScheduledMethod;
import up.fe.liacc.repacl.Agent;
import up.fe.liacc.repacl.proto.Behavior;
 
public class MyBehavior extends Behavior{
 
	public MyBehavior(Agent owner) {
		super(owner); // Sets the owner of this behavior.
	}
 
	@ScheduledMethod(start = 1, interval = 1)
	public void action() {
		System.out.println("Behaviour execution.");
	}
}
|MyContextBuilder.java
import repast.simphony.context.Context;
import repast.simphony.dataLoader.ContextBuilder;
 
public class MyContextBuilder implements ContextBuilder<Object> {
 
	@Override
	public Context<Object> build(Context<Object> context) {
 
		context.setId("test");
 
		// Create agent
		MyAgent t = new MyAgent();
		// Add the agent to the Repast context.
		context.add(t);
 
		return context;
	}
}
